page.title: 19Patchway Pensioners' Centre.
page.content: Around 1973 a group was set up, with Â£3.50 funds, in a room in the Community Centre, making and selling items. All the proceeds went into a building fund to provide a day centre for old age pensioners who live on their own. They worked for 7 years. The Parish Council gave the land. "Help the Aged" and the Almondsbury Charities contributed. In 1980 the Day Centre opened. The Davis Trust furnished the Centre. They now own their own building, run by three officers and ten committee, all old age pensioners. They pay all their own bills and are completely independent. The Centre is open from 9am to 4pm on Mondays and from 9am to 12am on Wednesdays and Thursdays. The voluntary cook is an old age pensioner. She has two helpers.
